intro: Phelline dumbeensis, commonly known as the Dumbénsis Phelline, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often trifoliate, and it produces small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phelline dumbeensis is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
